content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I hate rounding :D but nice contribution... I believe this should be approved

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool idea. As @ChiefChippy2 said, it's probably pretty easy to figure out and do, but good nonetheless.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good to me.

A little bit towards the easy side but it's fine.

I agree with the comment of Rafarafa, so no Reverse mode please.

There is a mixture of the sections currently. Both instructions and constraints are written in the Input section. However, line numbers and variable types are missing.

For Input section, just write:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for which the calculation is needed.

"No negative..." can be deleted as it is already implied by the constraint 0 ≤ N < 12 below.

For the first sentence of Output section, just write:
<<Line 1:>> [[C]] (etc, copying the rest of your original wording).

Please refer to the example in the contribution guidelines in case of doubt: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Thanks.

The reverse mode is impossible, unless....

Here's your Lagrange interpolation :P, only works with validators though:
p = 36196405435.68553 * n + -26846794297.630947 * n ** 2 + 7315386606.468535 * n ** 3 + -867347055.9098046 * n ** 4 + 37714053.44050463 * n ** 5
print(f'{p:.02f}')

edit: I forgot the rounding
Haha you got the lagrange stuff down. Thanks for the feedback-- took off reverse.
Okay. Thank you for your feedback. I think I applied all the edits you suggested. Reverse mode has been excluded aswell.
